review_title: My experience was not very positive
pros: The University is relatively high ranked, so looks nice in your CV
cons: The University is overrated in terms of research. It aspires to be one of the best, because it is old. However, it is more a wish than reality. Add to this that there is a snobbish professor culture. Situation with diversity and inclusion is very poor. On the whole as everywhere in academia it depends strongly on the group you work in and your professor. But as I said there is overall unhealthy atmosphere. It was recently a wave in media when former North-East students stepped forward and complained about bulling inside the University. It is true what they said. Other groups such as women and people of colour and just not British people also have this problem there.

pros: Staff are passionate about their subjects and in four years I have yet to have a bad lecturer. Buildings are well maintained and the people are always helpful and friendly. I felt very welcomed and had a fantastic time taking advantage of all of the wonderful societies, clubs and sports before the lockdown. Since then staff have continued to teach in an engaging way and have done their best to get students involved where possible despite the very difficult situation.
cons: I started in 2017 and every single year I have lost teaching time to strikes and industrial action. No effort was made by the university to resolve these issues in a satisfactory way and no reimbursment was recieved for the loss of teaching.
